lexUnit.name: promise.n

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: an assurance that one will do something or that something will happen

sentence.text: Then she had to say hello to Mike , then her mother again , with more laughter and tears and a promise that she would go out .
He repeated promises that the council was doing all it could to improve the quality of life for residents in the area .
This would be a promise to deliver anything up to ten songs in a year .
Mr Phelan is referring to my promise to read the Bible at a rate of five chapters a day , thus finishing it in a year .
To this was added the promise to privatise British Coal if the Conservatives were re-elected for a fourth term .
Bills are certificates containing a promise to pay a specified sum of money to the holder at a specified time in the future .

UNICEF 's State of the World 's Children 1991 report , published on Dec. 20 , said that an extra US$20,000 million would be needed to fulfil the summit 's promise to improve conditions for children by 2000 .
She repeated the request about the baptism and reminded me of my promise to baptise her baby .
Nearly half of the Bank 's borrower-governments break their promises about economic policy .
The spivs will wave away any objections with promises about easy resale , low cost finance and tiny deposit payments .
The politicians made vague promises about independence .

Bearing in mind that Labour Members have made many promises without costing them , will my hon. Friend tell us whether they have made promises about the environment in which they claim to be interested ?
He said Ms Armstrong 's promises about nursery provision were like ` whistling in the wind " .
When cornered he promises whatever you wish but , as soon as he escapes , he forgets his promise .

` Your promise , Gedanken .
One must be realistic in one 's promises to patients in respect of their admission to hospital for non-life threatening operations .
Mr Shamir said he would stick to his promise not to make concessions to the Palestinians over the occupied territories .

Sylvester Stallone is cast to type as a 20s Mafioso leader who finds his deathbed promise to his father uncommonly hard to keep .
CHANCELLOR Norman Lamont is considering raising national insurance payments in the spring Budget , despite John Major 's election promise that taxes will fall ` year on year " .
Mr Smith warned that if the Government raised VAT rates in next week 's Budget , it would be a huge betrayal of the British people after Mr Major 's election promise that there would be no increase .
The original intention was to provide a critical accompaniment to government promises of action on the inner cities made at the beginning of this Parliament .
Taking a break from the Bosnian conflict , he kept a long standing promise to his local swimming pool to help raise money for leukaemia and heart research .
